trend_summary: Across the time-series, farmland remains dominant while villages slowly enlarge along the main northeastâ€“southwest highway. Built-up footprints rise modestly, replacing scattered fields and edge woodlots, but no major urbanisation occurs. Field patterns shift, hinting at crop rotation and some woodland clearance in the southeast, balanced by small pockets of regrowth elsewhere.
notable_changes: Gradual outward growth of the principal town in the north-central zone.
New clusters of houses and sheds along the primary road corridor.
Woodland patches in the southeast converted to rectangular cultivation blocks.
Minor reforestation or hedgerow thickening visible in the northwest corner.
